alert.note: Alert for Camden; Dallas; Laclede; Miller; Polk (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 3:13PM CDT until April 15 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Dallas County in southwestern Missouri... Southwestern Miller County in central Missouri... Northwestern Laclede County in southwestern Missouri... Northeastern Polk County in southwestern Missouri... Camden County in central Missouri... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 312 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Camdenton to near Macks Creek to 7 miles west of Buffalo, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Lake of The Ozarks, Lake of The Ozarks State Park, Ha Ha Tonka State Park, Bennett Spring State Park, Osage Beach, Camdenton, Buffalo, Village of Four Seasons, Richland, Lake Ozark, Sunrise Beach, Urbana, Macks Creek, Linn Creek, Tuscumbia, Stoutland, Halfway, Bennett Springs and Louisburg. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 133 and 144. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
